title: 111_hr36
content: The Act may be cited as the "Presidential Library Donation Reform Act of 2009". It pertains to Presidential Libraries. The "Presidential Library Donation Reform Act of 2009" amends Section 2112 of title 44, United States Code to require Presidential library fundraising organizations to submit quarterly information on contributors who gave $200 or more. This information is to be submitted to specific entities on April 15, July 15, October 15. The "Presidential Library Donation Reform Act of 2009" requires Presidential library fundraising organizations to submit quarterly information on contributors who gave $200 or more. The submission deadlines are April 15, July 15, October 15, and January 15 of each year. The requirement continues until the Archivist accepts the land or facility for the archival depository or until four years have passed since the President left office. The term 'organization' refers to a fundraising organization established for Presidential archival depositories. 'Information' includes details like contribution amounts, sources, addresses, and dates. The Archivist must publicly disclose contribution information, including dates, without charge, in a searchable database. It is illegal to provide false information or omit details when making contributions to a Presidential library, with penalties under section 1001 of title 18, United States Code. It is illegal for Presidential library fundraising organizations to submit false information or omit material details, with penalties under section 1001 of title 18, United States Code. Additionally, it is unlawful for individuals to make contributions in another person's name or accept contributions made by one person in the name of another, with penalties under section 309(d) of the Federal Election Campaign Act of 1971. The Election Campaign Act of 1971 applies to violations related to fundraising for Presidential archival depositories. The Archivist will create regulations for this purpose. Section 2112(h) of title 44, U.S. Code applies to organizations raising funds for Presidential archival depositories, with restrictions on contributions made after the enactment of this Act.
